5|I have bought this product 3 days ago but not through Flipcart. It comes with a single 3.0 USB Cable which can also be used in USB 2.0 Ports.And they do not give any pouch or cover but you can also buy one outside. It does not have a shiny plastic but has a good matte finish. But one the sides it has a scratch prone plastic, so better to buy a pouch to protect your beautiful device. Pros: 1)You get 930 Gb. 2)Matte like finish to prevent scratches. 3)It does not become hot even after hours of usage. 4)Good read/write speed of 20/mbps on my USB 2.0. Cons: 1)The USB Cable is very short, if you are using a desktop try a different hard drive. I bought it for Rs.5,600 which is a good price for a 1 TB Hard drive. If you're looking for a 1 Tb hard drive for a laptop for heavy usage, i suggest you to get this one.
5|PROs: 1. Sweet sleek design with mat finish. 2. Good speed, I got upto 25 MBps write speed in USB 2.0, and 95 MBps in USB 3.0. 3. Although prices are not like it was 9 months ago, still it is a good bargain at 5700/- rather than going for other drives at 6000+ bucks. 4. Nice bundled backup software, that can take backup of your online content also. 5. Flexible design for connecting various adapters. If you want to use other connectivity like eSATA, Thunderbolt etc. just buy the adapter with the cable. 6. The older SeaGate GoFlex adapters is also fully compatible with it. CONs: 1. USB cable is very short. 2. Drive activity indicator is not very noticeable. It only changes light intensity. But most people are familiar with the changing blinking rate of the LED. But it's a personal choice of course. 3. Not military grade drop tested like the IoMega eGo and Transcend StoreJet. But no issues as it is also your personal choice and pricing difference.
5|Ordered the blue color model of this HDD for 5245 on 27th oct. Got it in 2 days thanks to quick flipkart self delivery. Coming to the drive, have used it for 5 days and quite happy with it's performance. Pros- 1) Stays cool for long hours 2) Very Silent 3) Good read & write speeds (20-30 MBps on usb 2.0, dont have a 3.0 port so cant say about that) 4) Cool looks (Matte finish) 5) Seagate Dashboard software is good. Cons- 1) Short cable (but enough for a laptop) 2) Scratch prone (Pouch required for protection) 3) LED indicator light does not blink when data transfer is ongoing. But pros definitely outweigh the cons. Good drive for this amount of money. Best in class. Definitely recommended.

It will die before it's so called '5years' warranty. a> White LED light keeps on blinking. b> HDD not detected on computer (not in Device Manager, not in Disk management & not in explorer) c> NO option from Seagate for recovering of the data. d> they will probably replace your HDD (but the new one will also die)...and no recovering. another IMPORTANT thing - ''It is a PRODUCT OF CHINA'' (Read the info given on back of your HDD) ONE request : PLZ don't buy Seagate HDDs (not even internals) and if you already have one..and it's working fine..PLZ save your ''important'' data somewhere safe (online data services)

5|Got it delivered in 4 Working days, in the best packing possible practically. Right from the moment I have opened the box, I became fan of Seagate. It is even smaller than half of the 500 GB HD Drives. Flipkart has the most attractive pricing, have done quite some research in this area and found FK to be most reasonable. Overall the best HDD to buy in the 1TB Segment.
1|I bought seagate HDD through flipkart around June timeframe. When I got the HDD, I was so happy with the sleek model and the speed. The reason why I had ordered seagate 1TB HDD is that, my 500 GB HDD is not detected by any computer. I lost all my data in that and I copied whatever possible data is present in my laptop is copied into the new 1TB new HDD ordered through flipkart. My happiness was only for shortspan of 1 month, as the new one also stopped getting detected by any computer. I have heard through my friends that, after seagate upgraded to optical technology, there any many problems reported and it has become highly unreliable. In my previous company also, there were problems with our high-end servers which has seagate hard-disks. I really regret buying seagate HDD as I lost all the data twice. They say, they will give replacement of both HDDs as they both are in warranty, but who will give me the data back? I dont not even want to give a single-star rating. I would not recommend buying seagate HDD.
5|I received it today and it is great. I have four other External HDs and two of them are Seagate. This one so far has the coolest looks. Works quietly and the port is a three-in-one to which three different types of adapters can be connected. Softwares are good for back-up, though the cover claims facebook, which I haven't tried yet, and am not sure will do in future. The looks are great. The Blue wood-ish texture is great and it is well protected with a fine film, you can choose to peel or not. The sides and the backs come laminated and the lamination is so neat that I do not want to take it out. The packaging was very good inside the Seagate box and outside it too. Flipkart as usual is great with delivery. Flipkart self-delivery has improved a lot. Before, there was a little amount of ambiguity with the Courier companies, now with Flipkart self-delivery it is flawless. This is a great buy, if you are looking in portable 1TB section. It is light, sleek and fast.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.
5|The Best Hard Disk ever from a brand like Seagate..... I purchased it at an affordable price of Rs. 4450/-, the lowest price of Seagate Backup Plus 1TB so far on flipkart or any other online shopping site..... It comes with a huge storage capacity of 931 GB with a data transfer speed of about 25 MBPS for USB 2.0. But this speed depends on the amount of data, the type of USB port & type of data that is transferred...... I bought the Black color HDD & I recommend to go for the Black color rather than spending a lot of money to get the colored (Blue, Red, Silver) piece of the same Hard Disk..... Now, talking about the size of the HDD, it fits easily in ones pocket. Its got a white LED as well to show the HDD activity. But it does not blink at all, rather it only changes light intensity...... Data cable length is short & is a bit of concern for Desktop Users & not an issue for Laptop Users. Only thing to worry from my point of view is that it gets slightly heated after hours of usage & data transfer...... Apart from this the HDD is less noisy compared to others & it also has 3 years of warranty from Seagate...... Besides all these flipkart's timely delivery & packing was awesome. A must buy External Hard Disk from Seagate.......
2|So for the first 6 months, the hard drive worked like a dream but then all of a sudden it stopped working. The activity light kept blinking and no computer could detect the device. Furthermore, I discovered that the serial number on the device did not match the serial number on the detect device window on my computer. My data is gone and I am not sure if I'll get a replacement. Also, the service center in Mumbai is difficult to find. So the next time, invest a little more time and buy electronics directly from a store instead of online.

The sides and the backs come laminated and the lamination is so neat that I do not want to take it out. The packaging was very good inside the Seagate box and outside it too. Flipkart as usual is great with delivery. Flipkart self-delivery has improved a lot. Before, there was a little amount of ambiguity with the Courier companies, now with Flipkart self-delivery it is flawless. This is a great buy, if you are looking in portable 1TB section. It is light, sleek and fast.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|I have been using Seagate products for last 15 years starting with my first PC. I also have 500GB (not from flipkart) that i bought 2 years ago, which is running absolutely fine. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

Cons: 1)The USB Cable is very short, if you are using a desktop try a different hard drive. I bought it for Rs.5,600 which is a good price for a 1 TB Hard drive. 5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

Copying Speed: USB 2.0: 27 MBps on a 2.4 GHz, i5 2nd gen, 8 GB RAM laptop. I haven't yet tried it with USB 3.0 Economical: Yes. A bigtime yes. It was a steal for Rs. 4,361. Buy Verdict: Go for it. It's cute, fast, highly portable, relatively inexpensive and comes with a 3 years warranty. Cons: I really wish it came with a case or pouch.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.
