5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

5|Flipkart as always very fast - product delivered within 2 days of ordering. The Seagate Backup Plus 1 TB Build quality - Compared to Seagate's earlier (Freagent Go) model (I have 320 GB and 500 GB) this does not feel so much sturdy. On day to day performance it does not have any significant impact. But when exposed to rough handling, how it performs is yet to be seen. However it is quite light weight and not bulky considering the storage size. Capacity - It gives 931 GB available storage space out of the box. There are some softwares (backup plus) that eats up part of the storage capacity. I think, by formatting the drive you can get more space if required, but some functionality will be lost. 4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

But this speed depends on the amount of data, the type of USB port & type of data that is transferred...... I bought the Black color HDD & I recommend to go for the Black color rather than spending a lot of money to get the colored (Blue, Red, Silver) piece of the same Hard Disk..... Now, talking about the size of the HDD, it fits easily in ones pocket. Its got a white LED as well to show the HDD activity. But it does not blink at all, rather it only changes light intensity...... Data cable length is short & is a bit of concern for Desktop Users & not an issue for Laptop Users. Only thing to worry from my point of view is that it gets slightly heated after hours of usage & data transfer...... Apart from this the HDD is less noisy compared to others & it also has 3 years of warranty from Seagate...... Besides all these flipkart's timely delivery & packing was awesome. 1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

Data cable length is short & is a bit of concern for Desktop Users & not an issue for Laptop Users. 1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: you will get hassle-free data backup and very good durability at cheap rate. If you are using your hard disk very frequently then WD hard disk should not be your choice. But if you just want to backup your internal hard disk data to the external hard drive and want a good looking handy hard drive then go for WD hard disk. Thanks for reading this review and I think this will help you to choose your hard disk and for their maintenance.

1|This harddisk is from seagate, so you can rely on it. But there are two main and important feature which this hard disk is lacking, namely "Usefull indicator light" and "Standy by". Older model of seagate with name "Seagte 1TB expansion Portable Drive" was having these features and newer model "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk" might have(99% sure, it will have) these feature. Indicator Light Feature - Newer and older 1TB drive both have indicator light, but behavior is different. In older model, during file copy, indicator light blinks fast and in standby mode, it blinks slowly. In this model, during file copy, indicator light just changes light intensity, which you can notice only with great concentration and there is no standby mode. Standby Feature - This is very very important feature as it is related to long life of the hard drive. In older 1TB model, there is feature that, if you there is no activity related to hard disk for 5-10 minutes, hard drive motor stops itself (standby mode) and waits for next activity and upon any hard disk activity, it starts itself. In this model, there is no standby feature. But "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk " must be supporting this feature. For e.g. if you you are copying 15 GB of movie to portable hard disk, it will take 15 min approx in USB 2.0 and a few minute in USB 3.0. Suppose you forgot to pullout hard drive for 8-10 hours. In this model, hard disk motor will keep on revolving for 8-10 hours. In older 1TB model and might be in "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk", after completion of file copy, hard disk motor will stop and goes to stand by after 5 minutes of no activity. So in short, this model will have life less than "Seagate Expansion Falcun 1 TB External Hard Disk".

4|For all those fellas who r confused between USB 3.0 hard disks. Let me know u something 1) All USB 3.0 hard disks provide same data transfer rate off around 60 Mbps on USB 3.0 port. (Tested HP, Seagate, and WD ). Primarily data transfer depends on type of file u r tranferring. Eg. Movies will transfer faster than some software. 2) All harddisks have same cable length. 3) Its that d brand name which causes price difference otherwise performance of all USB 3.0 hard disks are same(Atleast u will not notice any difference in daily usage). 4) The preloaded software in hard disks is for advertisement purpose as it merely copies files from ur pc/ laptop hardisk to ur external hard disk.

5|Hello friends, this is a short review of the above-mentioned three hard disk WD my passport, WD elements, Seagate backup plus: all are 1 TB hard disk and all are purchased from Flipkart. Using Seagate backup plus for last one year and WD elements for last six months and just purchased the WD my passport. All are decent hard disk having few cons. I had purchased all the hard disks during ongoing discount offers is and purchased the backup plus(red) @ Rs 4395/-, WD elements @Rs3590, and WD my passport(red)@ Rs4550. Which is very much cheaper than the retail shop. Coming to Seagate backup plus, it's a very good hard disk practically no vibration or heating issue and without any other significant issue. The connecting cable is short, but you should know that if the cord is too much long, then the data transfer speeds will also decrease. Look wise it is very good but still it is inferior to WD my passport or elements. The bundled softwares are very good for online backup. This hard disk has lowest reported failure rates. Its data transfer rate is blazing fast,more than 25mbps while transferring video files and a little bit lower in case of software and other types of file. But after continuous transfer of 100 GB, there is no or very little heating issue and no vibration issue. You may find very fine sound in the hard disk if you keep it closer to the ears during data transfer. Using WD elements 1 TB for last six months. It's a very good looking sleek lightweight hard disk. The today there is no issue. It's greater transfer rate is very much similar to that of Seagate backup plus. There is a little vibration during data transfer. I have one advice for those who are using WD hard disk is that, after getting your hard disk first install the software(smartware) in your desktop and configure the hard disk setting: set the idle time to the lowest available, that is, 10 min. What does it mean? After continuous non-using your hard disk for 10 min will put the hard disk to idle state. It will both decrease your power consumption as well as increase your hard disk longevity. One more thing, you should format your hard disk to NTFS and at lowest possible allocation units for example, 64KB. You should also routinely perform disk defragment and disk check up which will increase your device stability and performance. Coming to WD my passport, using it for last few days. It's nice look, lightweight and sleek design impressed me. Data transfer rates very similar to that of WD elements or more than that but lower than backup plus. There is little bit vibration issue but everyone should accept it because the disk of WD hard disk is placed very close to the casing box that's why the vibration is felt. Heating issue is very minimum compared to WD elements but more than Seagate backup plus. You should not transfer more than hundred GB data at a time in WD hard disks. You should also perform the maintenance task is mentioned in the WD elements segment. It is estimated that more than 6% hard disk fails within three years of purchase. Now, the final verdict, if you are trying to backup your personal photos videos or other important documents, you should always use more than one hard disk or you may backup those data in the cloud storage, e.g. dropbox or google drive. Otherwise if disk failure occurs, it will just make your life hell to recover the data and also recovery cost is too much. Seagate and WD are the best available hard disk in the world, so choose as per your requirement. But my suggestion is that if it is your first hard disk then go to Seagate backup plus: y
